sections.content: The property covered under Gift Settlement Deed No. 1037 of 2000 , dated 10/Apr/2000, executed by 1. Dunaboina Naguramma, 2. Duaboina Satyanarayana, 3, Dunaboina Srinivasa Rao and 4. Dunaboina Durga Venkata Naga Lakshmi in favour of Sanaboina Sri Lakshmi, towards the property admeasuring an extent of 181.5 Sq. Yds. (or) 1633.5Sq. Ft., bearing house number 8-2, comprised in survey number 52/1 situated in Thotaramudi Village and Grama panchayath, erstwhile East Godavari District within the District of Dr. B.R. Ambedkar Konaseema registered at sub-registrar office Amalapuram, is bounded as follows: North by: Property of Dunaboina Subrahmanyam 71, Ft South by: Property of Mattaparthi Appanna 72, ft East by: Property of Kudupudi Chandranna ,51.5 ft West by: Gram Panchayath Road

(A) As per Registered Documents: 1. The property in survey number 52/1 situated in Thotaramudi Village and Grama panchayath measuring about 181.5 Sq. Yds. (or) 1633.5Sq. Ft., was originally owned by Dunaboina Pedda Swami, Who acquired the property through inheritance.[Ref.Deed] 2. The aforementioned, 1. Dunaboina Naguramma, 2. Duaboina Satyanarayana, 3, Dunaboina Srinivasa Rao and 4. Dunaboina Durga Venkata Naga Lakshmi executed a Sale Deed on 10/Apr/2000, , registered as document No 1037 of 2000 , before the SRO Amalapuram favour of Sanaboina Sri Lakshmi, towards the property admeasuring an extent of 181.5 Sq. Yds. (or) 1633.5Sq. Ft., bearing house number 8-2, comprised in survey number 52/1 situated in Thotaramudi Village and Grama panchayath. 3.The aforementioned Sanaboina Sri Lakshmi, executed a Mortgage Deed on 05/Feb/2019 registered as document No. 665 of 2019 before the SRO Amalapuram in favour of The Kakinada Coprative Bank Ltd, Kakinada, Amalapuram branch towards the property measuring 181.5 Sq. Yds. (or) 1633.5Sq. Ft., situated in Thotaramudi Village and Grama panchayath. 4. The aforementioned Sanaboina Sri Lakshmi executed a Mortgage Deed on 05/Jul/2024 registered as document No. 12679 of 2024 before the SRO Amalapuram in favour ofThe Kakinada Coprative Bank Ltd, Kakinada, Amalapuram branch towards the property measuring 181.5 Sq. Yds. (or) 1633.5Sq. Ft., situated in Thotaramudi Village and Grama panchayath. Note: It is noted that a query was raised for a Active Mortgages vide Doc.Nos. 665 of 2019 and 12679 of 2024. Upon enquiry with the F.I., it was confirmed that the customer already paid the amounts release deed pending will be collected prior to disbursement. Hence it is advisible to F.I to verify and proceed as per internal policy process. (B) Additional Documents Supporting the Title : Note:It is to be noted that the HTR was not attached in this case, when the same is enquired with F.I., they reverted to release a conditional report. It is therefore advisable for F.I. to obtain HTR prior to the loan disbursement of the loan.
The mutation proceedings were not concluded in the name of the current owner, Sanaboina Sri Lakshmi.

Receipt Deed against Mortgage deed vide Doc.No. 665 of 2019* --* -- *Original

sections.content:
We have reviewed the documents provided to us as per the F.I policy and have concluded that the Sanaboina Sri Lakshmi, possesses a clear and valid title to the property measuring 181.5 Sq. Yds. (or) 1633.5Sq. Ft., bearing house number 8-2, comprised in survey number 52/1 situated in Thotaramudi Village and Grama panchayath, erstwhile East Godavari District within the District of Dr. B.R. Ambedkar Konaseema registered at sub-registrar office Amalapuram(414, subject to discharge of activemortgage vide Doc. No. 665 of 2019 and 12679 of 2024.

Further, the current owner, Sanaboina Sri Lakshmi is to be added as a party to the loan structure alongwith the applicant Sanaboyina Devivaraprasad.

Note:: It is to be noted that the online EC has been verified using the key parameters, namely the Document Number, Survey Number/House Number, and Split Survey/House Number of the concerned SRO, as per the Deed. However, cross-verification across multiple SROs has not been carried out due to the AP portal’s requirement of separate passwords for each search parameter, and the OTP-based authentication mechanism makes searches across multiple SROs operationally infeasible.
